definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: Birds sing in chorus every morning in the mountain forest.
sentences.chinese: 每天早晨山林裏的鳥雀們都要進行新一天的“合唱”。

sentences.english: There are small knots of birds frequently hovering and cherupping over the tree .
sentences.chinese: 三三兩兩的鳥雀不時在榕樹上空盤旋鳴叫。

sentences.english: In the morning, when the birds are roused by the stir of milking the cows, I will waken you.
sentences.chinese: 明日清晨，鳥雀被擠奶姑娘驚起時我會將你喚醒。

sentences.english: The sound of their fiddles is like the twittering of sparrows.
sentences.chinese: 他們的小提琴聲宛如鳥雀的調瞅。

sentences.english: Some of the rarest birds built (nests) in the old mossy trees.
sentences.chinese: 幾隻非常罕見的鳥雀在長滿苔蘚的老樹上築巢。

sentences.english: It did not give of bird or bush, Like nothing else in Tennessee.
sentences.chinese: 它不曾產生鳥雀或樹叢，與田納西別的事物都不一樣。

sentences.english: The birds still worm sound foliaceous hide.
sentences.chinese: 鳥雀林間寂，蟲鳴葉底藏。

sentences.english: Hawthorn berries are the birds' winter supplies.
sentences.chinese: 山楂果是鳥雀冬日補給品。

sentences.english: Birds have made the black prints on yellow.
Finch had regular flying, and closed to chirp to a person .
sentences.chinese: 有鳥雀常飛來飛去，嘰嘰喳喳着於人親近。

definition: to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
bright and beautiful/(of a landscape) gorgeous/(of a color) vibrant
luan and phoenix/husband and wife/virtuous person/sovereign/belle
insect or insect-like small creature (literary)/base person (used as a curse word)
to flicker/to flash on and off/to brighten and fade
to touch up (a piece of writing)/to add details (to a painting)
